DataElement.preferredName: Off-Treatment Adverse Event Patient Withdrawn Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a text field to describe patient refusal of treatment termination prior to the planned phase of a protocol for treatment completion due to unfavorable signs or symptoms related to use of a medical product.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to cessation of medical treatment for an individual prior to the planned phase of a protocol for treatment completion due to unfavorable signs or symptoms related to use of a medical product.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:A person who requires medical care.:Withdrawn; having ceased active participation in.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a text field to justify or explain the administration or cessation of therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
